title: About
text: This year’s Stellar Stats workshop aims to continue strengthening connections between the Statistics and Astronomy communities at U of T with a focus on research questions, types of data and data challenges, and methodologies. Our organizing theme this year is “Inference under Pressure”, with a focus on solving inference challenges that are shared across statistics and astronomy (e.g., censorship, small sample sizes, sampling bias, MCMC, etc.).

title: About
text:
Organizers
Department of Astronomy & Astrophysics (DoAA) and the Department of Statistical Sciences (DoSS)

Assistant Professor Josh Speagle
Assistant Professor Gwendolyn Eadie
Dr. Antonio Herrera Martin

title: 2023 Stellar Stats Workshop
text:
Date: Thursday, May 4, 2023


Cherry Room (9016), Department of Statistical Sciences, 700 University Avenue.  Online: Zoom link send by email 



10:00 - 10:05 | Opening remarks (Antonio Herrera Martin)
10:05 - 10:25 | Ting Li, Astro  Searching the faintest galaxies and star clusters with petabytes of data in the next decade
10:25 - 10:45 | Elena Tuzhilina, Stats Canonical Correlation Analysis in high dimensions with structured regularization
10:45 - 11:05 | Josh Speagle, Stats/Astro SBI++: Simulation-based Inference with Out-of-Distribution Measurement Uncertainties and Missing Data






11:30 - 11:37 | Phil Van-Lane, Astro A data-driven inference model for stellar age estimation using gyrochronology
11:37 - 11:44 | Emily Somerset, Stats A Spatio-Temporal Framework for Modelling Wastewater SARS-CoV-2 Concentration
11:44 - 11:51 | Sam Berek, Astro The HERBAL model: A hierarchical errors-in-variables Bayesian lognormal hurdle model for galactic globular cluster populations
11:51 - 11:58 | Grace Yu, Stats Mapping the Milky Way halo with Blue Horizontal Branch stars



12:00 - 13:30 Catered lunch



13:30 - 13:37 | Garett Brown, Astro Long-term Solar System Survival (Analysis)
13:37 - 13:44 | Ishika Bangari, Astro Population synthesis of fast radio bursts
13:44 - 13:51 | Keir Rogers, Astro Using cosmological emulators to accelerate the search for dark matter
13:51 - 13:58 | Sonia Markes, Stats Effect of the Infield Shift: Causal Inference in Baseball






14:15 - 14:35 | Marta Bryan, Astro TBD (Exoplanet-related)
14:35 - 14:55 | Jeff Rosenthal, Stats TBD (MCMC-related)
14:55 - 15:15 | Laura Rosella, DSI (Associate Director, Training) Year 2 Update on the Data Sciences Institute


 15:30 - 15:50 | Lamiya Mowla, Astro TBD (JWST-related)
15:50 - 16:10 | Stanislav Volgushev, Stats TBD
16:10 - 16:15 | Concluding remarks (Gwen Eadie)




16:15 - 17:00 Open Discussion Period
